definition: horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]

sentences.english: She used to travel with a circus.
sentences.chinese: 她過去常常用一個馬戲場旅行。

sentences.english: They make the circus lively and cause people to laugh。
sentences.chinese: 他們使馬戲充滿生氣，使觀衆捧腹大笑。

sentences.english: Father is in a good mood at the moment.Strike while the iron is hot and ask him to let you go to the circus.
sentences.chinese: 這時父親的情緒很好，乘此機會求他讓你去看馬戲。

sentences.english: So the hippodrome is the circus in Latin.
sentences.chinese: 所以賽馬場就是拉丁語中的馬戲表演場。

sentences.english: You could put on a small circus inside a 747-8.
sentences.chinese: 你甚至可以在裏面塞下一個小型馬戲團。

sentences.english: It's a dog and pony show.
Well, I know this duck that could be just brilliant in your circus.
sentences.chinese: 我認識一隻鴨子，在你們馬戲團肯定出彩。

sentences.english: I will join a circus and fly away on a flying trapeze.
sentences.chinese: 我就要變成馬戲團裏的空中飛人，飛得高高的。

sentences.english: Jone lost track of the money he spent at the circus.
sentences.chinese: 約翰看馬戲花的錢不計其數。

sentences.english: The acrobats got warmed up before the circus show.
sentences.chinese: 特技表演家在馬戲團開始前做些練習。

sentences.english: The circus experienced a calamity when the tigers escaped from their cages.
sentences.chinese: 當老虎從籠子裏逃出來時，馬戲團經歷了一場災難。

sentences.english: But it's not going to be the over- the - top circus you saw in 2006.
sentences.chinese: 但它不會是超頂級的馬戲你看到在2006年。
馬戲表演使孩子們興高采烈。

sentences.english: As the star of a circus, Boog has lived a luxurious life.
sentences.chinese: 身爲馬戲團的大明星，布榖過着十分奢華的生活。

sentences.english: "Geek" is the circus guy who bites the head off of live animals.
sentences.chinese: “怪咖”是在馬戲團中把動物的頭要下來的人。

sentences.english: He's an animal trainer at the circus.

definition: colored lantern (used at Lantern Festival 元宵節|元宵节)
to get together all at once
to beat the gong to open a performance
to start sth new or original (idiom); to break a new path/to break fresh ground
invitation tournament (e.g. between schools or firms)
